description.narrative:
the project of "Promoting community participation, particularly migrants, into budget analysis and monitoring in health financing in Kim Chung Commune, Dong Anh district, Hanoi". Impact: To contribute towards improved transparency, accountability and people's participation in budget process of Vietnam
Goal: Community and CSOs are empowered during public budgetary process, focusing on publichealth services budgeting in Kim Chung commune, Dong Anh district, Hanoi indicators goal: Level of participation of community and CSO during public budgetary process in Kim Chung commune At least ten of cases/files presented by local community regarding public budgetary process to be addressed by local authorities One documentation on participatory SEDP planning and budget monitoring, focusing on health financing, to be endorsed by local government
Result 1: Community people in Kim Chung commune, Dong Anh district, particularly migrants, increase their access to information and have ability to analyse public budget indicators result 1: At least 80% members of six self-help groups understand the community roles and responsibilites At least 80% leaders of six self-help groups are able to monitor and analyze budget of public services At least 80 % of people participating in regular meetings improve their knowledge about communal plans and socio-economic development progress. At least four issues concerning budget analysis and monitoring to be raised during quarterly meetings At least 50% of self-help groups can recall key content of quarterly discussion on an annual basis
Result 2: Community people in Kim Chung Commune, Dong Anh district, particularly migrants, increase their access to public healthcare service and are able to analyze and monitor public health financing in different health service settings indicators result 2: At least 80% of clients express their satisfaction regarding service quality in communal clinics, communal health centers, districthospitals At least 50% of community people, especiallymigrants, are provided information about health care insurance At least 25 health service providers in target areas commit to better service provision At least 80% feedbacks to public health services are responded
Result 3: Local authorities, including Commune People#s Committee and Commune People#s Council in Kim Chung, support and implement the participatory health budget analysis and monitoring process indicators result 3: At least 60% of community's recommendations/issues are reflected in communal SEDP Perspective of communal authorities on community participation on public budgetary process and SEDP development Six of discussions and meetings in which budget issues, particularly budget of public health services, are discussed
Result 4: CSOs, especially Network of Action for Migrant Workers (M.net) are able to take action to influence government agenda on people's participation in public budget monitoring process and other migrant related issues indicators result 4: Two of workshop on community participation in public budgetary process hosted by M.net At least 50% of M.net members can present in other workshops hosted by other CSO/Government about migrants' issues, multi-dimensional poverty, equity impacts of health financing for migrants

participating-org.narrative: Institute for Development and Commu Health

LIGHT is a local NGO established in 29 Sep 2003, based in Ha Noi with an average annual budget of 185,000 Euro, working with several target groups including informal migrant workers. LIGHT also partnership with Asia Foundation, Ministry of Health, Plan International, UNWomen, etc. LIGHT started partnership with Oxfam since 2014. LIGHT mission: LIGHT serve disadvantaged groups through our programs, which aim to improve their quality of life, sexual and reproductive health and social wellbeing. Based on their needs and concerns, we act as a bridge between them and available social and community resources to ensure these resources are used transparently and effectively
